pros: The people I work with are great. The students get a lot of assistance and are never left on their own to figure thing's out like at larger colleges and universities. Campus is beautiful. So far I am happy.
cons: Needs more organization as far as who is doing what in each department. More communication is needed between department heads and staff. Staff is left feeling stressed and confused a lot of times. A lot of the staff who have been at the college a long time are bitter about the way they have been treated in the past and present. Seems employees are not appreciated or respected.

review_title: It has been nightmare from the beginning.
pros: I am scheduled for 35 hour work week. Although I have never work 35 hours, I arrive early, leave late, skip lunch, bring work home, and work weekends.
cons: The management is dysfunctional. They are constantly reorganizing employees, moving employees, and changing the structure. However, it never works. The salary situation is a complete disgrace. I have never received a raise - not even a cost of living increase. The wages were frozen about 5 years ago, and everyone's salary was cut 2 years ago. Some people making less than when they started. The tuition remission policy was altered, which was their best employee benefit. The worst part of my job is attempting to navigate my day without being verbally abused by my manger. My entire department spends their day trying to appease a manager that is completely out of control. I have spent many nights awake dreading the next day and replaying the many insults I suffered at work. I have called out sick on occasion, because of verbal abuse. The interesting part is my reviews are great. The management is well aware of situation, but they will not take action. This manager has been in place for many years, and will not doubt remain in place long after I'm gone.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Bay Shore, NY
cons: closed down due to being in debt

pros: Some of the co workers who actually care and are decent people. Far and few between.
cons: Awful work environment. Management has run place into the ground and could care less about students. More and more lay offs time after time because of financial instability. Blame employees for their lack of management skills and ability to appropriately run a college. There is hardly any staff or students left. No room for growth as an employee and NEPOTISM beyond belief. If you are a male however you will get better pay and opportunities. The pay is a joke.

review_title: As bad as an employer, as it is a college.
job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Oakdale, NY
pros: Excellent medical and Rx benefits when I was there (I understand they are not any longer). Excellent and cohesive team I worked with in my department. Perhaps the best cohesive, cooperative and supportive department team in all my years of higher Ed and colleges worked for. Direct manager of my department was fair, and great to work for (before they fired or "laid off" him/her along with everyone else)
cons: So many to list, but will stick with the top few. Worst compensation (salary specific) of any college. Most salaries are around 20% lower than peer competitors in higher Ed. For example same position pays $48k-$54k most other places. WORST vacation package of any college - two weeks vacation is unheard of in higher Ed industry and they don't even give you the standard week between Christmas and New Years off to boot!  With abysmal wages they should at least have better vacation package. No money for anything we were always told, while there were 6 luxury Infinities for senior management in parking lot as if they were a Fortune 500 company or an institution on par with say Hofstra, and to allow that when they haven't given raises in 4-5 years! Disgrace. No respect from senior management. We were treated and looked at as worse than dirt when most colleges I worked for similar department we were treated excellent and understood we were a revenue center/were sales force bringing in the enrollment revenue and given tools and accolades to do so. Not at all true at Dowling. No understanding or idea of enrollment management principals, practices or philosophy. The college deserves all the negative press it has received, because while I was there it felt like it existed not to provide the poor quality, overpriced education they do, but instead existed to provide a certain few in senior admin their lifestyle and luxury company vehicles.

job_title: Counseling Health and Wellness Counselor in Holbrook, NY
pros: Opportunities for continuing education, enrichment.   Caring co-workers and leaders.
cons: Human Resources are limited in most departments.

pros: Satisfaction in helping parents and students. Great friendships with co-workers. Beautiful campus.
cons: Massive layoffs in 2012. Upper management and board of Trustee failure due to excessive cronyism. Went through 5 presidents in 8 years - one being a large donor that didn't even have a bachelor degree! No endowment. Horrible financial management.

job_title: Associate Director of Transfer Counseling in Oakdale, NY
pros: Location is beautiful. Lots of time off
cons: Building is falling apart. Poor staff morale. College in financial distress. Employees are so overworked the time they are allotted to take off they can't because of the workload.

review_title: Worst employer I ever worked for
job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Oakdale, NY
cons: Salary, time off compared to other college/university

pros: Small liberal arts college on a beautiful campus
cons: Limited staff  in many of the departments

job_title: Associate Professor in Locust Valley, NY
